sample_home.definition: Welcome to Qamous, a platform for learning colloquial Arabic words and phrases. Our goal is to provide a comprehensive resource for learners of Arabic dialects, including the Egyptian, Levantine, Gulf, and many more dialects.

The Arabic word "النهاردة" (pronounced: al-naharda) translates to "today" in English. It is commonly used in various Arabic dialects, including the Egyptian dialect. This term is employed to refer to the current day or the present moment, indicating the temporal context of events or discussions. In English, it is synonymous with "today," representing the immediate time frame in which a conversation or situation is taking place.

The Arabic word "معلش" (pronounced: ma3lish) is a versatile term used in daily conversations, particularly in the Egyptian dialect. Its primary translation is "never mind" or "it's okay" in English. Ma3lish is employed to express forgiveness, understanding, or to downplay a situation. It serves as a multi-purpose phrase, conveying a sense of reassurance or dismissing minor issues. In various contexts, ma3lish helps maintain a casual and easygoing atmosphere during interactions.

The Arabic word "يلا" (pronounced: yalla) is a popular term used across different Arabic dialects, including Levantine, Egyptian, and Gulf dialects. Yalla is a versatile expression that conveys encouragement, motivation, or a sense of urgency. Its primary translation is "let's go" or "come on" in English. Yalla is commonly used to spur action, rally enthusiasm, or prompt others to join in an activity. Whether used casually among friends or in more formal settings, yalla embodies a dynamic and spirited tone, encouraging engagement and participation.

The Arabic word "عفك" (pronounced: 3afak) is a polite term used in Moroccan Arabic to request or offer something. Its primary translation is "please" in English. 3afak is employed to make a polite request, seek assistance, or express courtesy in interactions. This term reflects the cultural emphasis on politeness and respect in Moroccan society, where social etiquette plays a significant role in communication.

"Smaitary" is an informal Arabic term that refers to intense cold weather. The word is derived from the fusion of "squee", or "saq3", and "rain", or "matar", forming "Samaitary". Over time, the "sa" was transformed into just "s", resulting in "Smaitary". In Libya, cold weather is described using various terms such as "safengri", "smaitary", and "shaloondi".

The Arabic word "كوباية" (pronounced: kobaya) is a colloquial term used in Egyptian Arabic to refer to a cup or glass. This term is commonly employed in informal contexts, such as casual conversations, social gatherings, or everyday interactions. Kobaya is a versatile word that denotes a container for beverages, typically tea, coffee, or juice.

The Egyptian Arabic word "فاكس" (although it may read like 'fake.s' but it’s pronounced 'fak.es') translates to "no" in English. So if someone asks you if you want to go to this place for dinner, just saying fakes will do the trick.

about.title: Welcome to Qamous!
about.text_2: . The goal of this project is to provide a platform for Arabic speakers to learn other dialects of Arabic (including slang) and to allow others to learn Arabic more easily. We aim to provide a comprehensive resource for learners of Arabic dialects, including the Egyptian, Levantine, Gulf, and many more dialects.
about.text_3: This project is open source and can be found on
about.text_4: . By supporting Qamous on GitHub, you'll be contributing directly to the ongoing development and improvement of this vital resource for Arabic language enthusiasts worldwide.
about.text_5: Your support can take many forms:
about.text_7: Share Qamous with your friends, colleagues, and fellow language enthusiasts. Together, we can build a strong community around this project and foster a greater appreciation for the Arabic language and its many unique and rich dialects. The more people who know about Qamous, the more valuable it becomes as a resource for learners and speakers of Arabic.
about.text_9: If you're a native speaker of an Arabic dialect or have expertise in Arabic linguistics, consider contributing words, definitions, examples, and other content to Qamous. Your contributions will help enrich the platform and make it more useful and engaging for learners of Arabic dialects. By sharing your knowledge and insights, you can help others learn and appreciate the beauty and diversity of Arabic language and culture.
about.text_11: If you're a developer or have experience in software development or design, consider
about.text_12: contributing to the Qamous project on GitHub
about.text_13: . Whether you're skilled in front-end design, back-end development, database management, or other areas of expertise, your contributions can help enhance the functionality, usability, and performance of the platform. By collaborating with other developers and contributors, you can help shape the future of Qamous and make it an even more valuable resource for Arabic language learners and enthusiasts.
about.text_15: If you or your organization is passionate about supporting language learning, cultural exchange, and the preservation of Arabic dialects, consider sponsoring the Qamous project. Your sponsorship can help cover the costs of hosting, maintenance, development, and promotion, ensuring that Qamous remains a free, accessible, and high-quality resource for Arabic language enthusiasts worldwide. By sponsoring Qamous, you'll be making a meaningful contribution to the preservation and promotion of Arabic language and culture. Your sponsorship will enable us to dedicate more time and resources to roll out Qamous faster and build new features that benefit the Arabic language community.
about.text_16: Qamous is more than just a dictionary; it's a celebration of Arabic language and culture. With your support, we can take Qamous to new heights and ensure that Arabic language learners have the tools they need to succeed.
about.text_17: Together, we can make Qamous a vibrant, inclusive, and dynamic platform for learning, sharing, and celebrating the richness of Arabic language and culture. Thank you for your support and for being part of the Qamous community!
about.text_18: Learn about the latest Qamous team's research
about.description: Qamous is a platform dedicated to preserving and promoting colloquial Arabic words and phrases. Our mission is to provide a comprehensive resource for learners of Arabic dialects, including the Egyptian, Levantine, Gulf, and many more dialects. By offering a diverse collection of words, definitions, and examples, we aim to facilitate language learning and cultural exchange. Qamous is designed to be an inclusive and interactive space where users can contribute, learn, and engage with the richness of Arabic language and culture.
